column4: Just having a few issues witf nfs.. here is my exports.. can anyone see anything wrong with it? As the client I'm trying to mount on is sayong operatio denied / permission denied..

Excuse the typos :P
:P
At any rate does anyone know why my client refuses to mount this share... have I missed anything? http://pastebin.com/583243
I suppose it's a uid problem
that could be it.. would you mine expanding a little..
can you mount it?
nope, thats the problem
I'm using breezy to a macosx client.. previously in gentoo I had it working but didnt save my confs and it's been a while since I've done anything with nfs
mount manually? "mount whateverserver:/media/data-core /mnt/whatever"
first, check the nfs-server runs with your exports, check the syslog for it
I don't know mac, but nfs-server writes to log
Any idea how I turn on the insecure port availability? Think macosx needs to use nfs that way..
I don't know mac
Server side I mean.. see in the syslog.. > Mar  4 20:26:31 rendai-netserv kernel: [ 1183.044804]  nfsd: request from insecure port (10.1.1.30:53670)!
ohh its cool found it..
kernel option?
good, so, it's in "man exports"
Like so: (async,no_subtree_check,rw,insecure)
it's okay, someone may already knew it
I wont buy mac, it's getting worms now
Yeah I know O_o.. not my machine though so I coudlnt care any less :P
when mac goes intel and maxOS ends up with viruses :) time to switch
